sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

sentences.english: All the hotel’s bedrooms are light and airy.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的所有客房都明亮通风。

detailed_translations.chinese: 空气的；通风的；幻想的；轻快的；空中的
detailed_translations.english: an airy room or building has plenty of fresh air because it is large or has a lot of windows

name: outfit
trans: （尤指供特殊场合用的）一套衣服

sentences.english: She bought a new outfit for the party.
sentences.chinese: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。

sentences.english: a cowboy outfit
sentences.chinese: 一套牛仔服装

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion
to provide someone or something with a set of clothes or equipment, especially ones that are needed for a particular purpose

name: manly
trans: 有男子汉气概的，适合男人的

sentences.english: a deep manly voice
sentences.chinese: 低沉雄浑的嗓音

detailed_translations.chinese: 男子气概的；强壮的；适于男人的
detailed_translations.english: having qualities that people expect and admire in a man, such as being brave and strong

sentences.english: our new range of fabrics and wallpapers
sentences.chinese: 我们新的织物和墙纸系列

sentences.english: The country’s social fabric is disintegrating.
sentences.chinese: 该国的社会结构正在瓦解。

detailed_translations.english: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc

sentences.english: We like our staff to show their individuality rather than wear a uniform.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢员工穿出个性，而不是穿制服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 个性；个人；个人特征；个人的嗜好（通常复数）
detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone or something different from other things or people

sentences.english: Stick reflective tape on your school bag.
sentences.chinese: 给你的书包贴上反光带。

detailed_translations.chinese: 深思熟虑的；反映的，反射的
detailed_translations.english: a reflective surface reflects light

sentences.english: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他下车往底下看了看。

sentences.english: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
sentences.chinese: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。

sentences.english: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 她穿了件时髦的夹克，里面是一件 T 恤衫。

sentences.english: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
sentences.chinese: 一顶棒球帽裹住了她的满头金发。

sentences.english: He has on his jeans and a long-sleeved blue denim shirt with a white T-shirt underneath.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿牛仔裤和一件蓝色长袖粗斜纹棉布衬衫，里面还有件白色T恤衫。

sentences.english: The shooting-range is lit from underneath by rows of ruby-red light fixtures.
sentences.chinese: 射击场被一排排宝石红照明装置从下面照亮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…的下面；在…的形式下；在…的支配下
detailed_translations.english: directly under another object or covered by it
Underneath is also an adverb
the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else

sentences.english: Bradford made an obscene gesture.
sentences.chinese: 布拉德福德做了个下流手势。

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["calls from an unknown person saying obscene things"],"COLLOINEXA":["obscene phone calls"]}
sentences.chinese: 下流骚扰电话

sentences.english: obscene photographs
sentences.chinese: 淫秽照片

detailed_translations.english: relating to sex in a way that is shocking and offensive

name: cuddly
trans: 不由得想搂抱的，可爱的

sentences.english: He is the most affectionate and cuddly dog I have ever known.
sentences.chinese: 它是我所知的最亲热和最可爱的狗。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不由得想搂抱的，可爱的
detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that is cuddly makes you want to cuddle them

sentences.english: The book contains few biographical details.
sentences.chinese: 此书包含的生平细节很少。

detailed_translations.english: Biographical facts, notes, or details are concerned with the events in someone's life

sentences.english: Two players were substituted for tactical reasons .
sentences.chinese: 两名球员因战术需要被替换下场。

detailed_translations.chinese: 战术的；策略的；善于策略的
detailed_translations.english: relating to what you do to achieve what you want, especially as part of a game or large plan

sentences.english: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.
sentences.chinese: 一个宽阔的山谷展开，通向一片平坦的高原耕地。

sentences.english: Inflation rates have reached a plateau.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨胀率已趋平稳。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

sentences.english: her heroic efforts to save her family
sentences.chinese: 她拯救家人的英勇行为

sentences.english: Lawrence’s heroic struggle against his destiny
sentences.chinese: 劳伦斯与命运的勇敢抗争

sentences.english: She portrayed him as a heroic figure .
sentences.chinese: 她把他描述为英雄人物。

sentences.english: He said his advice was: "No heroics, stay within the law."
sentences.chinese: 他说他的意见是：“不要有逞能行为，要依法办事。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 英雄的；英勇的；记叙英雄及其事迹的；夸张的
detailed_translations.english: extremely brave or determined, and admired by many people
If you describe someone's actions or plans as heroics, you think that they are foolish or dangerous because they are too difficult or brave for the situation in which they occur

name: culminate
trans: 终于获得某种结局或结果

sentences.english: All aspects of the printers system performance culminate at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上的所有方面的印表机系统的性能达到高潮。

sentences.english: We are approaching a Galactic wave right now and it will culminate in the Event.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在即将迎接一道银河能量波，而事件会在这道能量波达到高潮时发生。

sentences.english: the smell of rotten eggs
sentences.chinese: 坏鸡蛋的气味

sentences.english: Some of the wood was completely rotten.
sentences.chinese: 有些木头完全腐烂了。

sentences.english: The apples went rotten very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 苹果很快就腐烂了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 腐烂的；堕落的；恶臭的；虚弱的；极坏的
detailed_translations.english: badly decayed and no longer good to use

sentences.english: For centuries, people have dreamed of overcoming the natural limitations of our bodies and minds to become, in effect, superhuman.
sentences.chinese: 几个世纪以来，人类一直梦想着克服身体的自然限制，使某些想法变为现实，成为超人。

sentences.english: One of the difficulties is that there is no clear distinction between the way we use technology to make ourselves well and how we might use it to become better than well, or superhuman.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个困难是，如何运用技术使自己更健康与如何利用技术使自己不仅更健康而且更漂亮、或者使自己成为超人之间没有明确的区别。

sentences.english: If curing all human ills will be a piece of cake for a superhuman intelligence, then the singularity carries with it the promise of immortality - as long as you're still alive when it happens.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个超人智能来说，如果治疗人类所有疾病都不过是小意思，那么与奇点一同到来的自然该有长生不老的承诺——只要它发生的时候你还在世。

sentences.english: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
sentences.chinese: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

sentences.english: Many women do hard manual labour(= work with their hands ).
sentences.chinese: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。

sentences.english: Workers withdrew their labour (= protested by stopping work ) for twenty-four hours.
sentences.chinese: 工人罢工24小时。

sentences.english: a shortage of skilled labor
sentences.chinese: 熟练工人短缺

detailed_translations.english: work, especially physical work

sentences.english: distilled water
sentences.chinese: 蒸馏水

detailed_translations.english: to make a liquid such as water or alcohol more pure by heating it so that it becomes a gas and then letting it cool. Drinks such as  whisky  are made this way.

sentences.english: This is a silly and inaccurate way to think about time, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这是一种愚蠢和错误的看待时间的方法。

sentences.english: It could also be an invalidation notice specifying that part of data should not be considered in the integration process because it is inaccurate.
sentences.chinese: 它经常是一个无效的通告，部分的数据集成过程中应该不会被考虑，因为他们是错误的。

sentences.english: a long and distinguished career
sentences.chinese: 漫长而卓越的职业生涯

detailed_translations.english: successful, respected, and admired

sentences.english: The grassy plain gave way to an extensive swamp.
sentences.chinese: 青草覆盖的平原被广阔的沼泽地所取代。

sentences.english: the vast plains of central China
sentences.chinese: 华中地区的广阔平原

sentences.english: The advantages were plain to see.
sentences.chinese: 优势显而易见。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of flat dry land
very clear, and easy to understand or recognize

sentences.english: But there were no models outside the church and the military, so investigators into the train-wreck disaster [of 1841, in New York state] looked to the Prussian army for a model.
sentences.chinese: 但当时除了教会和军队以外，也找不到其他管理 模型以供参考。 所以1841年纽约那场火车失事的调查者把目光投向了普鲁士军队，从那里寻找模型。

sentences.english: Fortunately for the tea drinkers of Britain, Prussian blue is a complex molecule, so it is almost impossible to release the cyanide ion from it and the poison passes harmlessly through the body.
sentences.chinese: 但那些英国的饮茶人士还算走运，普鲁士蓝是一种化合物分子，它在人体中几乎没可能释放出氰根离子。 所以这种物质最终将安全无害的从人体中排出。

sentences.english: Macintosh, the son of a well-known dyemaker, developed an early interest in chemistry and science and by 20 was already running a plant producing ammonium chloride and Prussian blue dye.
sentences.chinese: 麦金托什是一位出名染匠的儿子，早年对化学和科学产生了兴趣，到了20岁，就已经开始经营一家生产氯化铵和普鲁士蓝染料的工厂。

sentences.english: This is the role of the coach, advisor, or teacher.
sentences.chinese: 这就是教练、顾问或者老师所扮演的角色。

sentences.english: When you purchase stocks, or equities, as your advisor might put it, you become a part owner of the business.
sentences.chinese: 当你买入股票或者等价物，你的顾问会告诉你说你已经成为了企业的部分所有者。

sentences.english: I don’t doubt her sincerity, but I think she’s got her facts wrong.
sentences.chinese: 我不怀疑她的诚意，但我认为她没弄清楚事实。

sentences.english: May I say in all sincerity that we could not have achieved this much without your help and support.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我真心诚意地说: 没有你们的帮助和支持，我们就不可能取得这样的成绩。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is sincere and really means what they are saying

sentences.english: Women have often been used as symbols of virtue.
sentences.chinese: 女性常被用作美德的象征。

sentences.english: Wilkins is now extolling the virtues of organic farming.
sentences.chinese: 威尔金斯现在盛赞有机耕作的好处。

detailed_translations.english: moral goodness of character and behaviour

sentences.english: the decline in standards of personal morality
sentences.chinese: 个人道德标准的下降

sentences.english: The authorities are protectors of public morality.
sentences.chinese: 当权者是公众道德的捍卫者。

detailed_translations.english: beliefs or ideas about what is right and wrong and about how people should behave

sentences.english: An old Arab proverb says, "The enemy of my enemy is my friend."
sentences.chinese: 有一句古老的阿拉伯谚语说：“我敌人的敌人是我的朋友。”

detailed_translations.english: a short well-known statement that gives advice or expresses something that is generally true. ‘A penny saved is a penny earned’ is an example of a proverb.

sentences.english: She leapt over the fence.
sentences.chinese: 她跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
sentences.chinese: 他把一根枝条扔到河里，那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

detailed_translations.english: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
a big jump

sentences.english: a disapproving frown
sentences.chinese: 不以为然的皱眉

detailed_translations.english: showing that you think someone or something is bad or wrong

sentences.english: a stack of bills clipped together
sentences.chinese: 夹在一起的一沓钞票

detailed_translations.english: to fasten something together or to be fastened together using a clip
to cut small amounts of something in order to make it tidier
a small metal or plastic object that holds or fastens things together

sentences.english: This movie gets darker with every scene and so does the soundtrack.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影随着故事的进行愈发黑暗，其原声带亦如此。

sentences.english: Lose the speaker cables without losing a single detail from the soundtrack.
sentences.chinese: 没有扬声器电缆却没有从声道失去哪怕一个单一的音节。

sentences.english: The scenes of torture, all conducted by willing collaborators, are truly sickening, as in another way are the pro-Nazi propaganda broadcasts that figure regularly on the soundtrack.
sentences.chinese: 酷刑的场景非常可怖，全部由协作者们自愿拍摄完成，从另一方面来看正是那些电影原声带上经常描绘的鼓吹纳粹的宣传画。

sentences.english: paintbrushes in assorted sizes
sentences.chinese: 各种大小的画笔

sentences.english: assorted vegetables
sentences.chinese: 各种各样的蔬菜

detailed_translations.chinese: 组合的；各种各样的；混杂的
detailed_translations.english: of various different types

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…分等级；把…归为一类（assort的过去分词）

sentences.english: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。

sentences.english: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

detailed_translations.english: if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar

sentences.english: ...plunging through the undergrowth.
sentences.chinese: …冲过那片下层灌丛。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发育不全；生长在大树下的灌木；动物身上长在长毛下面的浓密绒毛
detailed_translations.english: bushes, small trees, and other plants growing around and under bigger trees

sentences.english: a grassy bank
sentences.chinese: 长满青草的河岸

detailed_translations.english: covered with grass

sentences.english: The cushions are starting to wear a little.
sentences.chinese: 这些靠垫开始有点磨破了。

sentences.english: His jeans have worn thin at the knees.
sentences.chinese: 他牛仔裤的膝盖处已经磨薄了。

sentences.english: You’ve worn a hole in your sock.
sentences.chinese: 你的袜子磨出了个洞。

detailed_translations.english: to become thinner or weaker after continuous use, or to make something do this

sentences.english: The fat, broad tyres had a good depth of tread.
sentences.chinese: 鼓鼓的宽轮胎上有一道很深的花纹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 踏；胎面；步态；鞋底；踏板；梯级
detailed_translations.english: the pattern of lines on the part of a tyre that touches the road
to put your foot on or in something while you are walking

sentences.english: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
sentences.chinese: 运输成本是企业的一大支出，因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

detailed_translations.english: for this reason

sentences.english: I’d have asked more questions, but I didn’t want to seem inquisitive.
sentences.chinese: 我本想问更多的问题，但我不想看上去那么爱打听。

detailed_translations.chinese: 好奇的；好问的，爱打听的
detailed_translations.english: asking too many questions and trying to find out too many details about something or someone

sentences.english: As the boss began to rant, I stood up and went out.
sentences.chinese: 老板开始咆哮时，我站起来走了出去。

sentences.english: Even their three dogs got bored and fell asleep as he ranted on.
sentences.chinese: 甚至他们的3条狗在他不停地夸夸其谈时，都觉得厌烦并睡着了。

sentences.english: "Let's get it over and done with," he ranted.
sentences.chinese: “让我们就此了结这件事情，”他咆哮道。

sentences.english: Part I is a rant against organized religion.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分是对有组织的宗教的怒斥。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone rants, you mean that they talk loudly or angrily, and exaggerate or say foolish things
Rant is also a noun

sentences.english: a highly automated factory
sentences.chinese: 高度自动化的工厂

sentences.english: The production process is now fully automated .
sentences.chinese: 生产流程现在全部自动化了。

detailed_translations.english: using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people

sentences.english: We will then send you an invoice for the total course fees.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们将寄给你一张全部课程费用的发票。

sentences.english: The agency invoices the client who then pays the full amount to the agency.
sentences.chinese: 那个代销处给客户开具发票，然后客户向代销处支付全部的款项。

detailed_translations.english: If you invoice someone, you send them a bill for goods or services you have provided them with

sentences.english: advertising that specifically targets children
sentences.chinese: 专门针对儿童的广告

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别地， 特定地； 明确地， 具体地
detailed_translations.english: relating to or intended for one particular type of person or thing only

sentences.english: Community punishment is used for less serious offenders.
sentences.chinese: 社区服务刑被用来处罚犯罪情节较轻者。

sentences.english: At 16, Scott was already a persistent offender (= someone who has been caught several times for committing crimes ).
sentences.chinese: 斯科特16岁时就已经是个惯犯了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is guilty of a crime

sentences.english: She looked into his eyes and beheld madness.
sentences.chinese: 透过他的眼睛，她看到了疯狂。

detailed_translations.english: to see or to look at something – sometimes used humorously

sentences.english: He leaned forward with a sly smile.
sentences.chinese: 他俯身向前诡秘地一笑。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sly cleverly deceives people in order to get what they want

sentences.english: The song was dreary and repetitive.
sentences.chinese: 这首歌又枯燥又重复。

detailed_translations.english: done many times in the same way, and boring

sentences.english: Our youngest daughter is a vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 我们的小女儿是个素食主义者。

sentences.english: dishes suitable for vegetarians
sentences.chinese: 适合素食者的菜肴

sentences.english: I’m thinking about becoming a vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 我在考虑戒除荤食。

sentences.english: Yasmin sticks to a strict vegetarian diet.
sentences.chinese: 亚斯敏坚持一种严格的纯素饮食。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does not eat meat or fish
Someone who is vegetarian never eats meat or fish

sentences.english: What you did wasn’t illegal, but it was morally wrong .
sentences.chinese: 你做的事并不违法，但从道义上讲是不对的。

sentences.english: There is a belief that village life is somehow morally superior to city life.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为乡村生活在道德方面从某种程度上说高于城市生活。

sentences.english: Such hypocrisy is morally indefensible.
sentences.chinese: 这样的虚伪在道德上是说不过去的。

sentences.english: The Constitution is not morally neutral but is based on certain central values.
sentences.chinese: 宪法不是道德上中立，而是以某些中心价值观为基础。

detailed_translations.english: according to moral principles about what is right and wrong

sentences.english: outlandish clothes
sentences.chinese: 奇装异服

sentences.english: Her story seemed so outlandish.
sentences.chinese: 她的故事太不寻常了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的；奇异的；异国风格的；偏僻的
detailed_translations.english: strange and unusual

sentences.english: Her clothes had all been ripped.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣服都被撕破了。

sentences.english: The sail ripped under the force of the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船帆被狂风刮破了。

sentences.english: Impatiently, Sue ripped the letter open .
sentences.chinese: 休急不可待地撕开信封。

detailed_translations.english: to tear something or be torn quickly and violently
a long tear or cut

sentences.english: gaudy jewelry
sentences.chinese: 俗丽的珠宝

detailed_translations.english: clothes, colours etc that are gaudy are too bright and look cheap – used to show disapproval

name: unnoticed
trans: 不引人注意的，被忽视的

sentences.english: Elsa stood unnoticed at the edge of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 埃尔莎悄悄地站在人群边上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不被注意的, 被忽视的
detailed_translations.english: without being noticed

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

sentences.english: He lifted his arms in a flamboyant gesture .

sentences.chinese: 我仅仅是说我们直观地了解协作。

sentences.english: People intuitively know you usually get what you pay for, and those who are good at what they do rarely give it away without some special reason.
sentences.chinese: 人们往往会根据你的酬金来直观地了解你，如果没有什么特殊原因的话，那些专长于某方面的人是很少会放弃报酬的）。

sentences.english: a nice quiet spot on the beach
sentences.chinese: 海滩上一个安静的好地方

sentences.english: I chose a spot well away from the road.
sentences.chinese: 我选了一个远离马路的地点。

detailed_translations.english: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time

detailed_translations.chinese: 认出， 发现； 玷污
detailed_translations.english: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

sentences.english: The use of compulsion in psychiatric care cannot be justified.
sentences.chinese: 在精神病治疗中使用强制手段是不正当的。

detailed_translations.english: the act of forcing or influencing someone to do something they do not want to do

sentences.english: One sign of a heart attack is a tingling sensation in the left arm.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病发作的一个征兆是左臂有刺痛感。

sentences.english: The sex scenes in the film caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片中的性爱镜头引起了轰动。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, especially the sense of touch

sentences.english: You’ll have to rub harder if you want to get it clean.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想把它弄干净，就得更使劲地擦。

sentences.english: I hurriedly rubbed myself dry.
sentences.chinese: 我赶紧把自己擦干。

detailed_translations.english: to move your hand, or something such as a cloth, backwards and forwards over a surface while pressing firmly

sentences.english: She died following a massive stroke.
sentences.chinese: 她重度中风后去世了。

sentences.english: a stroke patient
sentences.chinese: 中风患者

sentences.english: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
sentences.chinese: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。

sentences.english: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
sentences.chinese: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly

sentences.english: He accused the government of a cover-up.
sentences.chinese: 他指责政府隐瞒实情。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to prevent the public from discovering the truth about something

sentences.english: Scratch my back – I have an itch.
sentences.chinese: 给我挠挠背——我觉得痒。

detailed_translations.english: an uncomfortable feeling on your skin that makes you want to rub it with your nails
if part of your body or your clothes itch, you have an unpleasant feeling on your skin that makes you want to rub it with your nails

sentences.english: a trivial detail
sentences.chinese: 细枝末节

sentences.english: I know it sounds trivial , but I'm worried about it.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这事听起来微不足道，但我还是放心不下。

detailed_translations.english: not important or serious; not worth considering

sentences.english: She felt the sting of tears in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉泪水刺痛了眼睛。

sentences.english: He was stung by a bee.
sentences.chinese: 他被蜜蜂蜇了。

detailed_translations.english: a sharp pain in your eyes or skin, caused by being hit, by smoke etc
(of an insect or plant) to touch your skin or make a very small hole in it so that you feel a sharp pain

sentences.english: Her paintings invite comparison with those of the early Impressionists (= they remind you of them ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的画作让人想起早期的印象派作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
detailed_translations.english: the process of comparing two or more people or things

sentences.english: I just shrugged my shoulders and ignored him.
sentences.chinese: 我只是耸耸肩，没有理睬他。

sentences.english: ‘Suit yourself,’ he said with a shrug.
sentences.chinese: “随你的便。”他耸耸肩说道。

detailed_translations.english: to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something
a movement of your shoulders upwards and then downwards again that you make to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

sentences.english: She has hair that refuses to curl.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发怎么也不卷。

sentences.english: Maria had curled her hair for the event.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚为这次活动卷了头发。

sentences.english: a little boy with beautiful blonde curls
sentences.chinese: 满头漂亮的金色鬈发的小男孩

sentences.english: Decorate the cake with chocolate curls.
sentences.chinese: 用巧克力圈装饰蛋糕。

detailed_translations.english: to form a twisted or curved shape, or to make something do this
a piece of hair that hangs in a curved shape

sentences.english: However, that method comes with a disclaimer: Do not use it unless you are sure of the result.
sentences.chinese: 然而，那个方法却有一个放弃声明：不要使用它除非您能确定这个结果。

sentences.english: And so as a way of understanding what at this point is really the sheer repetitiveness of this disclaimer, I want to propose a metaphor.
sentences.chinese: 因此为了理解这个论点是否真的,是这种放弃的纯粹的重复，我将会提出一个隐喻。

sentences.english: Christine squirmed uncomfortably in her chair.
sentences.chinese: 克里斯蒂娜坐在椅子上不自在地扭来扭去。

sentences.english: The boy tried to squirm free.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩想要挣脱开。

detailed_translations.english: to twist your body from side to side because you are uncomfortable or nervous, or to get free from something which is holding you

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

sentences.english: She was momentarily lost for words.
sentences.chinese: 她一时语塞。

sentences.english: Jimmy paused momentarily.
sentences.chinese: 吉米停顿了片刻。

detailed_translations.english: for a very short time

sentences.english: She took it calmly at first but under the surface was seething.
sentences.chinese: 她起初处之泰然，但内心却是气呼呼的。

sentences.english: She put a hand on her hip, grinning derisively, while I seethed with rage.
sentences.chinese: 她把一只手叉着腰，嘲弄地咧嘴而笑，而此时我已怒火中烧。

detailed_translations.english: When you are seething, you are very angry about something but do not express your feelings about it

sentences.english: The economy and outward appearance of the area have changed considerably.
sentences.chinese: 该地区的经济和面貌发生了很大的变化。

sentences.english: His clenched fist was the only outward sign of his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他那紧握的拳头是他内心愤怒的唯一外在表现。

sentences.english: Other poor countries looked outward, strengthening their ties to the economic superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 其他的穷国向外看，加强它们和经济大国的联系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外的；外面的；公开的；外服的；肉体的
detailed_translations.english: relating to how a person or situation seems to be, rather than how it really is

detailed_translations.chinese: 向外（等于outwards）；在外；显而易见地
detailed_translations.english: If you say that a person or a group of people, such as a government, looks outward, you mean that they turn their attention to another group that they are interested in or would like greater involvement with

sentences.english: Jed’s downright lazy.
sentences.chinese: 杰德这个人懒透了。

sentences.english: It’s downright disgusting!
sentences.chinese: 简直太恶心了！

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is completely bad or untrue
